intro: Sideritis × philothei, commonly known as Greek mountain tea, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Greece and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses including the treatment of respiratory and digestive ailments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for gardens and herbal collections.
